bibl.note: This is a letter from Tennessee Governor Aaron V. Brown to a Mrs. Spencer, dated August 18, 1847. The Governor tells Mrs. Spencer that he is not able to grant a petition for relief of her husband from the charges made against him at this time.

div.p: I regret exceedingly not being able consistently with a sense of official duty to grant the petition for the relief of your husband at the present time. I will hold it up for further consideration in reference to his health & any further statements in his behalf which may be presented. I would recommend that you apply to some of the public or businesses of cincinatti men known in this city, for the character of your husband for industry & integrity & that they believe in his innocence of the charge against him.
div.closer:
yours respectfully Aaron V. Brown Mrs. Spencer
sent to me
To whom it may concern
